column4: where is the trash folder located? I need to remove trash from command line b/c the gui doesn't work
then your trash should be emty i think
Windows needs to think that its boot drive is the master. I think there is a way to tell grub to tell windows that it is the master so that it works ok
you need to use the map command in your menu.lst file for grub
then that should work... did you remember to update-grub after changing your menu.lst?
what do you mean by update?
what does the windows section of your menu.lst file look like?
after you change the menu.lst file you have to run the command "update-grub" to actually update grub
ok, what you need to do is follow directions from: http://blog.firetree.net/2005/08/26/duel-boot-windows-with-grub/  pay attention to the map part under the windows entry
that tricks windows into thinking its the master drive so it'll boot property... if it doesn't think its the master it refuses to boot
yea, reading it now will try it
Ok good. I dual boot, thats how I have mine setup, and it works flawlessly... I've got to go hope that helped.
